00002 \brief  Convenience structures used by various functions
00003         within the library.  
00004 */
00005 
00006 // Header file written by Lachele Foley, summer 2007
00007 
00008 #if !defined(GLYLIB_GENERAL)
00009 #define GLYLIB_GENERAL
00010 /** Convenient, but dreadfully wasteful, arrays of strings ("Text")
00011 
00012 Need get rid of these ASAP...  Can they go now?*/
00013 typedef struct { 
00014         char *T;
00015 } llcharset;
00016 typedef struct {
00017         char T[501];
00018 } lcharset;
00019 typedef struct {
00020         char T[251];
00021 } mcharset;
00022 typedef struct {
00023         char T[51];
00024 } scharset;
00025 typedef struct {
00026         char T[11];
00027 } sscharset;
00028 
00029 /** \addtogroup FILE_UTILS */
00030 /*@{*/
00031 /** A structure for ease in passing sets of file info between functions */
00032 typedef struct {
00033         char *N; /// the name of the file -- use strdup to allocate/copy
00034         FILE *F; /// the file pointer
00035 } fileset;
00036 /// A structure for a function similar to the perl notion of "slurping" a file
00037 typedef struct {
00038         int n; /// number of lines
00039         char **L; /// each line
00040 } fileslurp; 
00041 /*@}*/
00042 #endif
